oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Wilson Infirmary article
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Achieving Recognition
Medical Profession
African Americans -- Hospitals
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An article about the Wilson Infirmary, a hospital for African Americans, located at 1st Avenue South and Hill Streets in Nashville.
John T. Wilson, a graduate of Meharry, opened the Wilson Infirmary and served as the Surgeon-in-Chief. It was opened in 1907 and it closed in 1912 when Meharry officially opened its own hospital.
